speaker: ELDERLY WOMAN
line: Land sakes, George, what are you trying to do?

speaker: TALL GEORGE
line: I was trying to be quiet.

speaker: ELDERLY WOMAN
line: Quiet? I smelled you on the stairs. 39 years, I'm still surprised that embalming fluid of yours doesn't wake the dead.

speaker: TALL GEORGE
line: Didn't wake old Zeke McPherson tonight, God rest his soul.

speaker: ELDERLY WOMAN
line: Well, you go outside and take those clothes of yours off so I can rest mine.

speaker: ELDERLY WOMAN
line: George!

speaker: TALL GEORGE
line: I'm going, Tahoma, I'm going.

speaker: TALL GEORGE
line: What the hell? What the hell is that?

speaker: TAHOMA
line: George?

speaker: MALE AGENT 1
line: So, this is where the bad kids are banished to.

speaker: MALE AGENT 2
line: Put me down here I'd probably cook up a lot of crazy ideas, too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Good morning.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Morning. Um... I'll catch you guys later.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Some friends... they're just curious.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not here to be a curiosity, Agent Doggett. I'm here to work.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I am, too, Agent Scully. I've been here all weekend and early this morning went over every X-File in the cabinet there. Just left to get some coffee.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well... do you have any questions?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Just a few. Maybe first you could tell me where your area is here and… uh…. where mine's going to be.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is my partner's office, Agent Doggett. You and I will just be using it for a while.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So, where do we get started?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Homicides: Two … in Idaho. White male, 62, undertaker by profession, he was killed on his front porch about ten feet away from his wife.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Holy god.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Cause of death was blood loss from numerous deep wounds … from bites. Any thoughts, any questions?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: "Bites"?

speaker: SCULLY
line: On his head torso and hands. Two of his fingers are missing... eaten off.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: By what, an animal?

speaker: SCULLY
line: These were murders. The, uh, bites on his wife appear to be human.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I've seen some violent crimes, I mean, some seriously screwed up stuff, but, uh... this is extreme. Is there demonstration of motive?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not according to local P.D.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Is there any pattern, uh … ritual or anything?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I have to admit, Agent Scully, I'm at a loss.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, that's a good place to start.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: You the folks from the FBI?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: Yale Abbott, Cassia County Sheriff's.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi. Agent Scully. This is Agent Doggett.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: We like to think we can handle our own problems around here but a couple hotshots up in the county seat seem to think this is beyond us. Not that we don't appreciate your coming out all this way to give us a hand.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, I hope we can. I have to admit I'm a little baffled by what I've seen.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: Oh, really?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Understand, Detective, that we've seen cases like yours regularly on our unit. Agent Doggett has only just been assigned to the X-Files.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can assure you that there's nothing baffling about human bite marks.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: Well, that's just what I was getting around to, ma'am. We're not so sure now that these bites are human.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: The bodies were discovered by neighbours, so there was contamination of the general crime scene. My boys did a real damn good job of separating the various shoe prints and pulling these. Come on over.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: Right there, see that?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What is it?

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: It's not human, I know that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's not quite animal, either.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: There's only four toes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's not an unheard of birth defect. Uh, no more rare than polydactylism.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: What did she just say?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I assume she means it could be human.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Is that a fair assumption?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I say that assumption is the problem here. A strange print is found and immediately the most important piece of evidence is just thrown out to try and force an explanation. Maybe this print can help explain those bite marks.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: How?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not quite sure yet.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: She's not quite sure yet.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, I have to say I've worked a lot of homicides but if the victims laid out here for any time at all in a setting like this, it'd be pretty remarkable if they didn't attract animals.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think that post-mortem predation is definitely a consideration here, but I only see one print and if it were an animal there would be numerous prints all over here and in the yard.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You agree, Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm going to go take a look around.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: You know I got two old folks in the morgue mauled beyond recognition. I have no motive to go on, no intent. There's not one shred of evidence that cries out for a human explanation, yet you stand there telling me flat out that what we're looking for is a man. Thanks for everything, Agent Scully. We'll take it from here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sure your explanation will mollify all those hotshots down at the county seat, Detective and relieve any general anxiety about what this thing might be … but a man.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Is that a second print?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It could be but I'm not sure if it tells us anything.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, maybe there's no prints in the yard because whatever made these didn't go through the yard. It came through the house.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, if anything, I'd say this print leads up the stairs.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Think I've got another partial here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You know, there is a more obvious explanation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mm-hmm.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The more basic answer is what we're dealing with here is simply a man. A psychotic killer with a deformed foot. You're familiar with the principle of Occam's Razor?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. You take every possible explanation and you choose the simplest one. Agent Mulder used to refer to it as "Occam's Principle of Limited Imagination."

speaker: SCULLY
line: Unless you have a simple explanation as to how a killer with a deformed foot leaves a print only every 25 feet.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Or to what he'd even be doing up here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't know. I'm trying to figure it out just like you are.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dark up here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What do you see? Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Right now, not a heck of a lot.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If there was anything up here it might have gone out that window.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You ever carry one of these?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Never.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: "V" for victory.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You said the male victim was missing two fingers? Well, how did the fingers get up here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, from their smell, I'd say they were regurgitated. Recently.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: By what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I saw those on the porch, too.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Looks like, to me... I don't know. Like it was... it was...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hanging there?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're still here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. Well, I was waiting for some lab results and then I wanted to take another look at the body.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Why? What did you find?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nothing that will allay anyone's fears about what killed this man or his wife.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: "What"? You mean "who" killed them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, to be honest, what I found here leans more towards an animal explanation. The, uh, scratches on the body match the four-toed prints that we found. And the bites have fang-like tears. What I thought were marks left by human molars are now inconclusive because of enzymes that were found in the bites which are clearly inhuman- - anticoagulants which … are found solely in the saliva of bats.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Bats.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. I can't exactly explain it but I realize that I owe the Detective an apology.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, I'm not so sure about that. Montana headline circa 1956. The story's the same as what you told me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "The creature was taken to the county coroner who confirmed it was neither man nor animal."

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Two days later, the county coroner was disemboweled by something with sharp teeth and four-toed claws. Something that ate several body parts and regurgitated them elsewhere.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did they ever find it?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Five men died or disappeared and then the killing stops. Doesn't say why. But 44 years later it appears that it's back and killing again.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: You see those marks, right? And the ones over here on the rafter?

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: If you ask me, those look like claw marks. I don't care what kind of a savage he is, what did this isn't human.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, if I may speak for Agent Scully, I think we're both prepared to concede that point, Detective.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: Then you know what this thing is?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I've got a newspaper article I want to show you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: A rather strange account from 1956…

speaker: SCULLY
line: I found something. A photo album. I think it's our first break on this case.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The victim's daughter-- Ariel-- her dead body was pulled from the river here last week.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: I got that call. Had to come tell Mrs. McKesson the bad news. You trying to say there's some kind of connection?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, you not only told her mother that her 62-year-old daughter was dead but that her body had been horribly and inexplicably burned. A daughter who, by the way, she hadn't even seen in over 40 years. Since 1956, to be exact-- which is the date your article says those first killings started.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: Do you see the connection?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm not, uh... sure where you're going with this, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The daughter is the connection.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: How is that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know exactly but these killings only started up since her burned body has been found.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: Honest to god. You just jump at whatever explanation is the wildest and most far-fetched, don't you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I suggest that you jump at it, too because her body may have been burned for a reason and you're going to want to exhume it in order to find out why.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: You want me to dig up a dead body when I have real people out there whose lives are in real danger?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hey...

speaker: SCULLY
line: What did you say to him?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, I told him to dig up the body. Isn't that what you wanted?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What else did you say to him?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, I told him that you were … um … a... leading authority on paranormal phenomena and who are we to argue with an expert.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, I am not an expert. I am a scientist who happens to have seen a lot. I am just making a leap here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, I am sure you have your reasons.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, so, so, what, you told him to exhume the body when you don't even necessarily believe me yourself?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I told you I spent the weekend looking through that cabinet full of X-Files and I saw how pretty much every X-File broke-- with a leap. Now, maybe I'm just an old- fashioned cop but I don't take leaps. In my experience leaps only get people killed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I'd say that you're taking a pretty big leap believing in that article... about a human bat.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: I don't know how you do it. Called the judge's order in a half ago. You guys are fast.

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER 1
line: Yep, we're really fast when someone's done most of our work.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER 1
line: We got out here, somebody had already dug up the box. All we had to do was haul it out. I don't know what they were using but they scratched up the wood on the lid real good. See?

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: Let's get this down to the morgue. I think the sooner, the better.

speaker: DETECTIVE ABBOTT
line: God!

speaker: CLOCK INDICATES THAT IT IS 1
line: 07 AM. She looks up as DOGGETT enters. The SHERIFF'S DEPUTY sticks his head in and addresses DOGGETT.)

speaker: SHERIFF'S DEPUTY
line: I want a word with you.

speaker: SHERIFF'S DEPUTY
line: Look, we listened to you. The Detective listened to you. We could have been out hunting this thing down, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You should be doing that now.

speaker: SHERIFF'S DEPUTY
line: Now? Now's too late for the Detective, isn't it? Look, we don't need you telling us what to do or your partner. She's the one responsible for this.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Nobody's responsible for this except for whatever did it.

speaker: SHERIFF'S DEPUTY
line: Look, I don't care who she is or what she is, she's not touching that body. We don't need her far-out theories. She's not welcome here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened to the lynch mob?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You hear all that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I heard enough.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Things have taken a little turn.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't think so, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, you can think what you want but I think this looks bad for the FBI.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was unavoidable.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: How do you figure that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is the body pulled from the river. She died of natural causes-- congestive heart failure-- but her body was only burned afterwards.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: By who, and why burn it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, obviously to cover something up.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, but what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's what I still don't know.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Look, we know what we're looking for. We should be out there looking for it. We're not going to catch it standing here speculating.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, it kills like an animal, but with purpose. It stalked the detective for the same reason that it stalked the old woman and the undertaker. Each of those victims had had contact with this burnt body. The undertaker prepared it. Her mother ID'd it and the Detective got the call when she was found.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, who else would have had contact with it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The, uh, man who found her in the river. A, uh, Myron Stefaniuk.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Stefaniuk?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: One of the hunters in the photo in 1956 was Ernie Stefaniuk.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's an address in his file. I hope we're not too late.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mr. Stefaniuk?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Myron Stefaniuk?

speaker: MYRON STEFANIUK
line: That's me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Good. Sorry. You gave us a bit of a scare. We went to your home up the road and we couldn't find you.

speaker: MYRON STEFANIUK
line: Why would that scare you?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, sir, we work with the FBI and we have reason to believe that your life may be in danger.

speaker: MYRON STEFANIUK
line: I'm in danger?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, we're investigating some murders, sir, that we believe may be connected to the burnt body that you found recently.

speaker: MYRON STEFANIUK
line: I fished it out of the river. What have I got to do with anything?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, we're not saying for sure that you do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It may just be your connection to the body.

speaker: MYRON STEFANIUK
line: There is no connection. I just fished it out of the river.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, sorry, sir, but that may be enough.

speaker: MYRON STEFANIUK
line: It's nonsense. Leave me alone.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Ernie Stefaniuk. Lived in Montana in 1956. Do you know him?

speaker: MYRON STEFANIUK
line: Ernie was my brother.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He was one of three hunters that killed a man that was half animal.

speaker: MYRON STEFANIUK
line: Please! That was a long time ago.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Do you know where we can find him to talk with him, sir?

speaker: MYRON STEFANIUK
line: My brother's dead. That thing killed him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, I have a newspaper story that says your brother disappeared.

speaker: MYRON STEFANIUK
line: That was 40 years ago. Leave it alone! Leave me alone!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know, we've been out here for nine hours. The only thing this man seems to be in danger of is terminal loneliness.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe I'm wrong. Maybe this is all just a... a grand coincidence and we're wasting our time out here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You were so sure before.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I was sure of the facts as I had deduced them scientifically. Maybe I'm... I'm trying to force them into shape. Maybe I'm manufacturing a theory.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, what happened to taking a leap?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe I'm just trying too hard.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: To do what? To be Mulder?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You know, I'm not Oxford educated. About all I know about the paranormal is men are from Mars and women are from Venus. But I don't think you're wrong, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What makes you say that?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, I'm no Fox Mulder, but I can tell when a man's hiding something. Myron Stefaniuk fishes a woman out of the river who's been gone for 40 years. He has a brother he hasn't seen in over 40 years. A brother who just happened to hunt down some kind of creature over 40 years ago.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, what does he have to hide?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, that's what I'm hoping this good cop work is going to show us.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You there!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stop right there!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I see him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stop where you are! Put your hands up and out! Now, turn around, slowly.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Are you Ernie Stefaniuk? Are you Ernie Stefaniuk?

speaker: MASKED MAN
line: Yeah.

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: How's a man supposed to live when his fear becomes obsession? You'd do the same thing. Who wouldn't who wanted to live?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You never left the island?

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: 44 years-- I wouldn't dare knowing it was out there. That it could come back for me.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You know something about it? About what this thing is?

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: I know on the evolutionary ladder bats are real close by the apes and just as we came from the apes so might a man, sprung from a bat. To live and hunt like a bat but with the cold-blooded vengeance of a man.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Even if that were true, sir, how could it possibly find you out here on an island?

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: I needed to cut off all contact. Communication could be only one-way. My brother helped me. And then there was my wife.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It was her body your brother pulled in.

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: She gave up everything to be with me. I forbade her to tell her mother. 44 years on six acres of island, she made only one demand. To be buried in consecrated earth. She was a Catholic her whole life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Stefaniuk... it's killed four people. All of whom would have had traces of your scent through various degrees of contact with your wife's body.

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: My brother?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Your brother's okay, Ernie.

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: But he had contact with Ariel's body. It'll come after him, too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's all right. We spoke with him earlier today.

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: Today? Today, he might have been fine but this thing hunts likes a bat. It only attacks at night.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Stay here. Stay with him.

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: I still don't understand.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's that?

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: How'd you find me out here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We followed your brother.

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: No, I mean who figured it out?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was sure that what we were looking for was something other than a man. Uh, the detective who was running the case didn't believe that, and...uh, … he's dead.

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: But your partner, he believed it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think he does now.

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: So it was you who figured it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I … I made the connections but it was Agent Doggett that got us out here.

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: You ought to be wishing he hadn't.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me?

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: The moment you stepped foot here... You're marked now, you know that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, I'm here to protect you.

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: And how are you going to do that? You thought of everything... Except that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, this thing, Mr. Stefaniuk is … uh … still flesh and blood. It can be killed.

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: What do you think? It's just going to come walking through the door, there? It's waited 44 years. It'll wait out there as long as it takes until you can't stand it anymore. How long can you wait, huh? A lifetime? To live in fear like this, a young woman-- are you prepared to sacrifice family, children and spend your life terrorized by a monster?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is that?

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: It's ground radar. The sensor's set at ten feet high. Anything big enough to set it off is coming in through the trees.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You hear it?

speaker: ERNIE STEFANIUK
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe I got it. Maybe I killed it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If you've got a gun, get it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. I'm okay. But you're not, Agent Doggett. I got you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sorry I'm late. I received a fax up in my old office from Ernie's brother, Myron Stefaniuk.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's alive? Where is he?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He doesn't say. He sent this from a small storefront business just across the state line in Wyoming. He's gone into hiding.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you believe it, Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Believe it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That this thing is still out there and someday it's going to come after us?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm pretty sure I hit it, Agent Scully. Pretty sure you hit it, too. The guys upstairs were making some noise about this case-- about what's in our field report.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. You'll get used to it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I, uh... I never had a desk in here, Agent Doggett but I'll see that you get one.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: All right.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And I just want to say, um... thank you for watching my back.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, I never saw it as an option. I'm sure you don't either.
